attributes.action: Withdrawal of all recent benefit reforms
attributes.additional_details:
I am asking that the DWP revoke the following benefit reforms :
-Introduction of PIP to replace DLA
-introduction of Under occupancy tax
-benefit claimants to have funding suspended when appealing a decision.

Reforms should only be put forward once extensive and highly publicised research by independent bodies are carried out.

I believe the above reforms have not been thoroughly discussed with all concerned. The department do not seem to be aware of the huge negative impact these reforms will have on lives.

I propose that:
all social housing residents with one "extra" bedroom & are disabled, I'll or elderly should not be subject to ANY variation of the under occupancy tax.

DWP should be heftily fined for getting a benefit decision wrong putting the onus on a correct decision first time.

Claimants GP's should be mandatorily consulted on ALL disability/illness related benefits.

PIP criteria for highest rate mobility should be the same as DLA
